page.title: 18A Life of Service./Blaby.
page.content: Cecil Ward has witnessed many changes in his 80yr life in Blaby:piped water, flush toilets,electricity,modern postal service,milk in bottles,a population grown from 750- 1914 to 7500-1985,improved social conditions & Blaby by-pass.{1896}Grandsire one of 1st councillors to newly formed Parish Council.{1937}Cecil elected youngest Parish councillor. Became temporary clerk after few months but this lasted 43yrs.{1937}made 1 of 3 special constables,became Sergeant{1947. 1945 {to present,}Secretary,Turner Education Foundation providing grants for boys going to university, (currently trying to make available for girls also). Cecil was a church choir member from 8yrs old .Church Warden {1956-80.}As a councillor he has met Govt.ministers, attended Queen's Gdn.Party,and chosen to give 1st talk on Radio Leicester.
